xml.title: Summary
xml.body:
All statistics are based on differences between model daily means and observations. Detailed result are also available from the Arctic MFC.

Results are provided for various sub-domains. This is mostly due to variable data coverage (e.g. altimeter data from Jason-2 are only available south of about 66N, Argo data for profiles of salinity and temperature are not available for shallow regions such as the Barents Sea). Maps and region descriptions are available from web pages at the arctic centre.

Statistics for salinity and temperature are based on data from profiling buoys. Results from the Nordic Seas sub-region may be noisy due to sparse data coverage.

Statistics for sea ice concentration and sea ice edge position are based on a limited-area composite ice chart product for the northern Nordic Seas, the Barents Sea, and an adjacent sub-domain of the Arctic Sea. (Data for the Baltic Seas are filtered out.) The model product is mostly independent of these data.

Statistics for sea ice drift are based on pattern recognition of data from satellite-born radar instruments. The results represent the 24-h drift (position offset during a 24-h period). The model product is independent of the radar data.

Statistics for sea level anomaly are based on data from the Jason-2 altimeter.

Statistics for sea surface temperature based on in situ data are from drifting buoys. The model product is independent of these data. Results from the Barents Sea sub-region may be noisy due to sparse data coverage.

Statistics for sea surface temperature based on remote sensing data are derived from measurements from the AVHRR instrument that flies on METOP-A.
